org.qbroker.sonicmq

Class SonicMQMessenger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qbroker.sonicmq.SonicMQRequester
      • org.qbroker.sonicmq.SonicMQMessenger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<com.sonicsw.mf.common.metrics.IMetric>, Connector, Requester

    public class SonicMQMessenger
extends SonicMQRequester
    SonicMQMessenger connects to a SonicMQ broker and converts the JMS messages into JMX requests. The request retrieved from a message is supposed to be as follows:
    ACTION Target attr0:attr1:attr2
    where the colon delimited attributes are optional. If there is no attribute defined, it will display all attributes. Currently, it only supports the action of display and listen.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

    • Method Detail

      • listen

        public void listen(XQueue xq)
            throws javax.management.JMException
        It adds a notification listener to the SonicMQ broker and saves the XQueue instance as notice for the downstream. The plugin method of onNotification converts the notifications into JMS TextMessages and puts them into notice. Since the method is called by the broker, it is passive or asynchronous in the nature. Therefore, it will ignore the actions of flow controls. In case the XQueue is on PAUSE state, the messages may still flow into it. Once the XQueue is full, the extra notifications will be dropped. So please set fairly large capacity for the XQueue of notice.
        Throws:
        javax.management.JMException

      • onNotification

        public void onNotification(javax.management.Notification notification)

      • display

        public void display(XQueue xq)
             throws javax.management.JMException,
                    javax.jms.JMSException,
                    TimeoutException
        It listens to an XQueue for incoming JMS messages and extracts the JMX request from each message. After the creating a list of JMX requests, it sends each request to the SonicMQ broker as a query and waits for the response back. The response will be loaded into body of the request message according to the result type, similar to a DB qurey.

        It also supports the dynamic content filter and the formatter on queried messages. The filter and the formatter are defined via a JSON text with Ruleset defined as a list. The JSON text is stored in the body of the request message. If the filter is defined, it will be used to select certain messages based on the content and the header. If the formatter is defined, it will be used to format the messages.
        Throws:
        javax.management.JMException
        javax.jms.JMSException
        TimeoutException
